topic.title: Installing as non-root, non-sudo
topic.shortdesc: Installation on Ubuntu as non-root, non-sudo user is used is used only for development purposes.

body.note: This installation method is intended for development purposes only and not supported in production.
body.p: A non-root, non-sudo installation will run Couchbase Server and all Couchbase Server command-line tools.

ol.li:
After downloading the Couchbase Server DEB package, go to the directory where it is located and extract it:
dpkg-deb -x couchbase-server-version.deb $HOME
In the directory where you extracted the files, you will see /opt and /etc subdirectories.
After you extract the Couchbase Server installation files, go to the subdirectory: cd opt/couchbase

Run the following script to relocate the Couchbase Server installation to the present working directory (PWD):
./bin/install/reloc.sh `pwd`
This allows you to continue the installation as a non-root, non-sudo user.
